results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 6]
results.brief_description:
Much of this film contains scenes of landscape in Alice Springs including the Standley Chasm.

There are a few different modes of transport seen throughout such as a 1956 Austin Healey, the Ghan locomotive, a bus owned by the Tuit’s coach services and horses.

Also shown is the John Flynn Memorial Church and Adelaide House, Alice Springs, the first hospital which was created by John Flynn.

Of interest for Aboriginal heritage is a few scenes of local Aboriginal men working on a tractor and Aboriginal horsemen.

The film finishes with a scene of the Drayton Home in Melbourne.

Selected hightlights list:
00:00:02:00 - Train carriage carrying a 1956 Austin Healey 100

00:00:12:00 – Old Ghan locomotive at the Old Ghan Heritage Railway and Museum Alice Springs

00:00:38:00 - Alice Springs, John Flynn Memorial Uniting Church

00:00:51:00 - Adelaide House, Alice Springs

00:00:59:00 – Two Aboriginal men working on a tractor

00:02:25:00 – Passengers exiting the bus – Tuit’s Coach Services

00:03:49:00 – Anzac Hill Memorial lookout - Alice Springs

00:05:10:00 – Scenic – Rocky hills on the way towards Standley Chasm, Alice Springs

00:06:57:00 – Standley Chasm

00:10:21:00 – Unknown saleswoman in a shop

00:10:25:00 – Cattle yard with cattle coming off a train carriage with 1954 Ford Mainline Utility in view

00:10:47:00 – tourists taking photos of Aboriginal horsemen

00:13:50:00 – Scenic reflection in a Puddle

results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 5]
results.brief_description:
This film follows the Drayton family on a Methodist missionary cruise to Papua New Guinea.

It begins in Sydney Harbour upon a passenger ship with a streamer farewell and continues with a visit to Stony Creek Falls and the Forest Gardens, Karunda before heading to Kwato and later Raboul, Papua New Guinea.

There are scenes of the Stony Creek train, bridge and falls as well as the Barron Falls.

In Kwato, there are many scenes of local men, women and children going about their daily activities including the making of Sago.

In Robaul, the tourists are treated to local celebration with music, costume and dance.

There a few scenes with boats, ships and canoes from Papa New Guinea including a canoe race.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 – Ship departure from Sydney dock with crowds and streamers

00:01:50:00 – Overflow Train and carriage Kuranda with Mr and Mrs Drayton and Ted Drayton

00:02:16:00 – Stony Creek Falls with tourists on the bridge and train. Stony Creek, Cairns

00:02:58:00 – Barron Falls, Cairns

00:03:34:00 – Mr and Mrs Drayton, unknown woman and Harold Drayton in the Rain Forest Gardens, Karanda

00:03:49:00 – Albert Drayton and sister Mavis in the Rain Forest Gardens, Karanda

00:06:18:00 – Jack Wallis, Mrs Drayton, Mr Webster and Mr Drayton, Kwato

00:06:23:00 – Mr Drayton with Local Men, Kwato

00:06:46:00 – locals making Sago, building a boat and weaving, Kwato

00:07:33:00 – Reverend Wesley Amos and son drinking from coconuts

00:07:52:00 – Mr and Mrs Drayton with a group of local kids singing, Kwato

00:08:37:00 – Mavis in canoe with two local men, Kwato

00:09:21:00 – Missionary Choir, Kwato

00:09:38:00 – Canoe Race - Kwato

00:10:01:00 – Albert Drayton and locals, Kwato

00:10:33:00 – Raboul, New Guinea showing the Mission House, a local policeman and locals dressed in tradition garments ready for performance

00:11:24:00 – Traditional dance and musicians playing percussion, Raboul

00:12:37:00 – Closeup of one of the headdresses, Raboul

00:12:59:00 – After ceremony, bringing of gifts members of the cruise including live birds on a stick. Raboul

results.title: The Youth who wanted to shiver
results.creator_credit: Bosustow Entertainment, Acton Films, Nick Bosustow, C B Wismar and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of the classic fairy tale by the Brothers Grimm, about Jack who knows no fear and wants to be able to shiver. All help fails until his bride pours a bucket of tiny fish over him.

results.title: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale
results.creator_credit: Bosustow Entertainment, Churchill Films, Nick Bosustow, C B Wismar and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: A Grimm’s fairy tale about a humble fisherman who frees a prince from a spell. The fisherman’s wife siezes the opportunity to have all her wishes granted but ends up where she started, thus learning a bitter lesson.

results.title: Is it always right to be right?
results.creator_credit: Stephen Bosustow Productions, Nick Bosustow and Lee Mishkin
results.brief_description: This fast moving parable, designed to provoke discussion without alienating any group, highlights the centres of divisiveness in our society, the generation gap, poverty, war and race. It tells of a land “where men were always right”. This animated film is a winner of many awards including an Academy Award. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: Sunshine and shadow
results.creator_credit: Steeplechase Films, WGBH (Boston), Thirteen, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.), New York Historical Society, Ric Burns and Lisa Ades
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “New York: a documentary film”.
Episode 3: SUNSHINE AND SHADOW (1865-1898) charts New York’s history during the decades following the Civil War when it continued to grow demographically, geographically and financially at a staggering rate. It explores the incomparable fortunes of the robber barons at the unabashed corruption of political leaders in an era when the expansion of both wealth and poverty- and the schism between them- built to a complex. The episode ends with the consolidation of the five boroughs to form Greater New York on January 1, 1898. Narrated by David Ogden Stiers.

results.title: [William Dobell]
results.brief_description: On the tranquil shores of Lake Macquarie, William Dobell lives and works. He and Dame Mary Gilmore discuss his work and its development - rough sketches from real life later translated to danvas; commissioned portraits; and landscapes. Studies of some of his better known works are included. Contains some b&w footage.
